alert.note: Alert for Wheeler (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 11 at 12:26PM PDT until April 12 at 8:14AM PDT by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Pendleton OR has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Oregon... John Day River at Service Creek affecting Wheeler County. .A quarter to half inch of rain has fallen in the last 36 hours with an additional tenth of an inch of rain expected the next 24 hours. The combination and rainfall and runoff has caused the river to rise, before falling this evening into Wednesday morning. For the John Day River...including Service Creek...Minor flooding is forecast. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/pdt. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...John Day River at Service Creek. * WHEN...From this afternoon to tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 11.5 feet, the river rises out of its banks and minor flooding is possible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:30 AM PDT Tuesday the stage was 11.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:30 AM PDT Tuesday was 11.6 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 11.9 feet late this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight to 6.1 feet late Sunday morning. It will rise to 7.3 feet Tuesday afternoon. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 11.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 12.9 feet on 03/14/1983. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
